H0.text: who made the first spanish landing on the mainland of north america. Hernando de Soto

H1.text: who made the first spanish landing on the mainland of north america. Juan Ponce de León

H2.text: who made the first spanish landing on the mainland of north america. Álvar Núñez Cabeza de Vaca

H3.text: who made the first spanish landing on the mainland of north america. 1535

A4.text: Spanish slave expeditions had been regularly raiding the Bahamas since 1494, and there is some evidence that one or more of these slavers made it as far as the shores of Florida.

A5.text: Juan Ponce de León led the first official European expedition to Florida in 1513.

A6.text: In April they sighted land, anchored and went ashore.

A7.text: Cabeza de Vaca and the three other men reached Mexico City.

A8.text: The journey of Alvar Nuñez Cabeza de Vaca and his companions from Florida to the Pacific occurred between 1528 and 1536.
